p: More insight about the influence that each mechanism and intervention has on HIV prevalence after a 15 year period is found in the sensitivity analysis summarized in Fig 4. The partial rank correlation coefficients between each of the parameters and the HIV prevalence for men and for women are displayed as bar graphs. A bar to the left indicates a negative correlation—increasing the parameter reduces HIV prevalence. A bar to the right indicates a positive correlation—increasing the parameter increases the annual incidence.
